page.title: 10THE FORD MOTOR COMPANY
page.content: The name of fords has been linked with Dagenham since the company recognized the potential of the large marshy site on the River Thames 60 years ago. The management have streamlined production to increase efficiency. Now only the Fiesta and Sierra cars are made at the factory which claims to have the most modern production line in Europe. there are 120 robots and new automatic control systemsplus a vast conveyer and transfer network. Originally,the workforce came from the Becontree estate, but now many travel by road and rail. A ferry links Dagenham with the Dagenham jetty. Unfortunately, automation has resulted in a reduction in the number of employees.
